Sentence: Sybil accuses him (Seymour) of letting another little girl, Sharon Lipschutz, sit on the bench with him (Lipschutz) while he (Lipschutz) played the piano
Sybil tells Seymour he (Seymour) should push Sharon off the piano bench next time
Sybil asks Seymour whether he (Seymour) likes Sharon Lipschutz, and Seymour tells her (Sybil) that he (Seymour) does, especially the fact that she (Sybil) is nice to small dogs and always kind
